citeinfo.title: PLS Corners with Presettlement Vegetation Information

descript.abstract: A point database storing information on vegetation type information and general location of bearing trees used in conjunction with the original Public Land Survey (PLS). This database contains the actual location of section corners, rather than the location of the bearing trees themselves. The data are derived from land surveyor notes, which include descriptions of vegetation and landscape characteristics along survey transects. This database is described in greater detail in the publication: Minnesota's Bearing Tree Database, by John Almendinger, Biological Report No. 56, Minnesota Department of Natural Resources, 1997.
descript.purpose: The data set is one source of information for scientists wishing to model environmental and ecological conditions present at the time of the original PLS survey.

timeperd.current: The data are derived from original survey notes that cover the period of 1846-1908.

theme.themekey: Presettlement Vegetation, Public Land Survey, PLS Sections, biota

idinfo.useconst: The data included here were provided by the Minnesota Natural Heritage Program and Non-game Research Program of the Division of Fish and Wildlife, Minnesota Department of Natural Resources (DNR). The DNR is not responsible for any inaccuracies in these data. Use of these data does not imply endorsement or approval by the DNR of any interpretations or products derived from the data.

dataqual.logic: Data are topologically correct using ARC/INFO 7.0.4.

horizpa.horizpar: Source layer pveg_btveg_pt3: The Original Vegetation Around Bearing Trees data set uses section corner and half section corner locations from the Minnesota Control Point Inventory (CPI), which contains the most horizontally accurate positions for these types of features currently available. The accuracy of section and half-section locations within the database can be considered accurate to within +/- 50 feet.

distinfo.distliab: The Minnesota Department of Natural Resources General Geographic Data License Agreement is online: http://www.dnr.state.mn.us/sitetools/data_software_license.html

stdorder.ordering: Please visit the download page for this dataset on the Minnesota Geospatial Commons website using the web link below (Online Linkage).
